intro: Lupinus squamecaulis, commonly known as the squamose lupine, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features palmate leaves with a distinctive squamose (scale-like) appearance on the lower stems. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Lupinus squamecaulis plays a role in stabilizing soil and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
